question_text: Why can't standard internal SATA cables be used for eSATA devices?
answer_options: eSATA uses optical signaling instead of copper
Internal SATA cables are not shielded for external use
SATA connectors have fewer pins than eSATA
eSATA requires analog signaling for legacy support
correct_answer: Internal SATA cables are not shielded for external use
explanation: eSATA cables and connectors are designed for external durability and shielding, unlike standard internal SATA cables.
